  16. (** {!Ast_iterator.iterator} enables AST inspection using open recursion.  A
  17.     typical mapper would be based on {!Ast_iterator.default_iterator}, a
  18.     trivial iterator, and will fall back on it for handling the syntax it does
  19.     not modify.

  21.   {b Warning:} this module is unstable and part of
  22.   {{!Compiler_libs}compiler-libs}.

  24. *)

  26. open Parsetree

  28. (** {1 A generic Parsetree iterator} *)

  30. ‌type iterator = {
  31.   attribute: iterator -> attribute -> unit;
  32.   attributes: iterator -> attribute list -> unit;
  33.   binding_op: iterator -> binding_op -> unit;
  34.   case: iterator -> case -> unit;
  35.   cases: iterator -> case list -> unit;
  36.   class_declaration: iterator -> class_declaration -> unit;
  37.   class_description: iterator -> class_description -> unit;
  38.   class_expr: iterator -> class_expr -> unit;
  39.   class_field: iterator -> class_field -> unit;
  40.   class_signature: iterator -> class_signature -> unit;
  41.   class_structure: iterator -> class_structure -> unit;
  42.   class_type: iterator -> class_type -> unit;
  43.   class_type_declaration: iterator -> class_type_declaration -> unit;
  44.   class_type_field: iterator -> class_type_field -> unit;
  45.   constructor_declaration: iterator -> constructor_declaration -> unit;
  46.   expr: iterator -> expression -> unit;
  47.   extension: iterator -> extension -> unit;
  48.   extension_constructor: iterator -> extension_constructor -> unit;
  49.   include_declaration: iterator -> include_declaration -> unit;
  50.   include_description: iterator -> include_description -> unit;
  51.   label_declaration: iterator -> label_declaration -> unit;
  52.   location: iterator -> Location.t -> unit;
  53.   module_binding: iterator -> module_binding -> unit;
  54.   module_declaration: iterator -> module_declaration -> unit;
  55.   module_substitution: iterator -> module_substitution -> unit;
  56.   module_expr: iterator -> module_expr -> unit;
  57.   module_type: iterator -> module_type -> unit;
  58.   module_type_declaration: iterator -> module_type_declaration -> unit;
  59.   open_declaration: iterator -> open_declaration -> unit;
  60.   open_description: iterator -> open_description -> unit;
  61.   pat: iterator -> pattern -> unit;
  62.   payload: iterator -> payload -> unit;
  63.   signature: iterator -> signature -> unit;
  64.   signature_item: iterator -> signature_item -> unit;
  65.   structure: iterator -> structure -> unit;
  66.   structure_item: iterator -> structure_item -> unit;
  67.   typ: iterator -> core_type -> unit;
  68.   row_field: iterator -> row_field -> unit;
  69.   object_field: iterator -> object_field -> unit;
  70.   type_declaration: iterator -> type_declaration -> unit;
  71.   type_extension: iterator -> type_extension -> unit;
  72.   type_exception: iterator -> type_exception -> unit;
  73.   type_kind: iterator -> type_kind -> unit;
  74.   value_binding: iterator -> value_binding -> unit;
  75.   value_description: iterator -> value_description -> unit;
  76.   with_constraint: iterator -> with_constraint -> unit;
  77. }
  78. (** A [iterator] record implements one "method" per syntactic category,
  79.     using an open recursion style: each method takes as its first
  80.     argument the iterator to be applied to children in the syntax
  81.     tree. *)

  83. ‌val default_iterator: iterator
  84. (** A default iterator, which implements a "do not do anything" mapping. *)
